data.title: Abell, Bess, 1933-
data.text:
Title:

Abell, Bess, 1933-

Description:

Bio: Bess Abell was Lady Bird Johnsonâ€™s Social Secretary. The daughter of Earle Clements, a man who served Kentucky as both its governor and senator, she lived her entire life around politics. The Johnsons were personal friends; they had hosted Bess' wedding reception when she married Tyler Abell, (stepson of syndicated columnist Drew Pearson) for she was a close as their two daughters, Lucy and Lynda Byrd.

Source:

Bess Abell poses in evening gown. Visit of President Francois Tombalbaye of Chad, Red Room, White House, Washington DC, 10/2/1968. Photo # d1925-13a by Robert Knudsen. White House Photo Office collection, LBJ Presidential Library, public domain.

Relation:

LBJ Connection: Assistant to Mrs. Johnson, 1961-1963; Social Secretary to Mrs. Johnson, 1963-1969

Identifier:

abellb

Citation

Abell, Bess, 1933-, Biographical info page, LBJ Presidential Library, accessed July 25, 2024, https://www.discoverlbj.org/item/abellb
